plugins.name: Reset Image
plugins.description:
Plugin Functions

  1. [Reset Size] - To reset an image layer to its original size/dimensions when it was first imported into Figma
  2. [Reset Effects] - To reset image fill effects
  3. [Reset Image] - To reset both size and effects at the same time


Guideline

  1. This plugin can work with one element or a selection of multiple elements.
  2. An element’s first fill (the most bottom one in the UI) has to be an image. You can have additional fills on top of this.
  3. If you try with elements whose first fill is not an image, the plugin will throw an error or those elements will be ignored.
  4. [Reset Size] If the original image was large, it will take some time to reset to the original size/dimensions and it may temporarily cause the Figma app to be unresponsive.
  5. [Reset Effects] The following image fill effects are reset: fill opacity, fill visibility, fill rotation, fill blending mode, all fill image filters (Exposure, Contrast, Saturation, Temperature, Tint, Highlights, Shadows).
plugins.tagline: Reset Image Size & Effects

plugins.name: QML Style Export
plugins.description:
Overview

A Figma plugin that converts selected Figma elements into QML code, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma designs and Qt/QML development.


Supported Elements

- Frames: Converts to QML `Item` or `Rectangle` with layout properties

- Components: Generates reusable QML components with variant support

- Component Instances: Handles component instantiation with property overrides

- Rectangles* Converts to QML `Rectangle` with styling properties

- Text: Converts to QML `Text` with font properties

- Ellipses: Converts to QML shape elements


Styling Properties

- Colors (fill and stroke)

- Dimensions (width and height)

- Border properties

- Corner radius

- Opacity

- Visibility

- Drop shadows

- Font properties

- Gradients


Layout Support

- Auto-layout (horizontal and vertical)

- Spacing and padding

- Alignment properties

- Parent-child relationships

- Anchoring


Component Features

- Reusable component generation

- Variant handling through states

- Property overrides

- Nested component support


Usage

1. Select Elements

- Select one or more elements in your Figma design

2. Export QML

- Click the "Export QML" button

- The generated QML code appears in the textarea

3. Clear Output

- Use the "Clear" button to reset the output area


Integration

The generated QML code can be directly used in Qt projects, maintaining the visual fidelity of the Figma designs while following Qt best practices and conventions.
plugins.tagline: Converts selected Figma elements into QML, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures

plugins.name: QQT Fanyi
plugins.description:
这是一个为简体中文设计的翻译插件，它包含两个功能：

1）将画布中的内容翻译为繁体/英文；

2）将画布名称翻译为繁体/英文。


使用方法：

1）启动插件。

2）选择单个或者多个画布。

3）选择需要翻译的目标语言。

4）如果只翻译画布名称则打开“只翻译画布名称”，翻译内容则可忽略。

5）点击“翻译”后即可完成设计稿适配。


*本插件只支持源语言为简体中文的字段


This is a translation plugin designed for Simplified Chinese. It contains two functions:

1) Translate the content in the canvas into Traditional Chinese/English;

2) Translate the canvas name into Traditional Chinese/English.


How to use:

1) Start the plugin.

2) Select one or more canvases.

3) Select the target language to be translated.

4) If you only want to translate the canvas name, turn on "Translate canvas name only" and ignore the translation content.

5) Click "Translate" to complete the design adaptation.


*This plugin only supports fields with the source language in Simplified Chinese
plugins.tagline: 这是一个为简体中文设计的翻译插件，可将画布名称和画布中的文字翻译为繁体或者英文

plugins.name: ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers
plugins.description:
ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers


Transform your UI designs with comprehensive analysis, accessibility insights, and visual attention mapping to boost conversions


ClarityUX is the ultimate design intelligence companion for Figma users seeking to perfect their interfaces. Our powerful AI analyzes your design files to provide actionable improvements, WCAG compliance checks, attention heat-maps, and detailed UX recommendations—all in one seamless workflow.


🔍 Key Features


Comprehensive Design Analysis using Groq and Gemini AI

- Composition Analysis: Get detailed feedback on visual hierarchy, balance, and layout structure

- Design Improvement Suggestions: Receive actionable recommendations to enhance your designs

- UX Enhancement Insights: Uncover opportunities to improve user experience and flow


Attention Heatmaps

- Visual Attention Mapping: See exactly where users will focus their attention

- Focus Area Analysis: Identify key areas drawing user attention and potential blind spots

- Interactive Heatmaps: Dynamically visualize user attention patterns across your designs



Powerful Insights

- Element-by-Element Review: Get detailed feedback on specific components and sections

- Data-Backed Recommendations: All suggestions supported by UX research and best practices

- Export Capabilities: Share insights with your team for collaborative improvement


💯 Benefits


- Save Time: Automate the design review process and focus on creative work

- Improve Quality: Create more user-friendly and accessible designs

- Data-Driven Decisions: Base design choices on objective predictive analysis rather than guesswork

- Learn & Grow: Develop better design instincts through AI-powered feedback


🚀 Getting Started


1. Select design elements you want to analyze

2. Choose which analysis tools to run (Design Review, Heatmap)

3. Review insights and implement suggested improvements


ClarityUX works with all Figma design elements including frames, artboards, groups, and components.


Perfect for UI/UX designers, product teams, and design agencies looking to create exceptional user experiences backed by data and accessibility best practices.


Upgrade your design workflow with ClarityUX today!

[3 free credits Included for new users]

plugins.name: Variables Generator
plugins.description:
Automate creating local variables by using JSON and speed up your workflow. Simply use the formats below to generate your variables, colors must be in a hex format and can support alpha channels via 8 digits.


⚠️ NOTE: This plugin only supports color variables, future updates may eventually support all variable types.


Demo

View this video demo of the plugin working with aliasing.


Single Mode

{
"VariableName": "Hex",
"VariableName": "Hex"
}


Multiple Modes

{
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
},
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
}
}


Aliasing

You can use aliasing across your local variables as long as their names are unique.


{
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias"
}


  1. VariableName is the name of your variable
  2. $VariableAlias is the name of the alias you are aliasing, be sure to include the $ to enable aliasing
  3. Mode is the name of your mode, each variable must contain the same modes
  4. Hex is the hex code of your color, supports 8-digit hex codes for transparency


Examples


Single mode that creates a color palette:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e",
"blue": "#519aba",
"green": "#8dc149",
"orange": "#e37933",
"pink": "#f55385",
"purple": "#a074c4",
"red": "#cc3e44",
"steel": "#7494a3",
"yellow": "#cbcb41"
}


Multiple modes that use 8-digit hex codes:


{
"tab-activeBackground": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#ffffff",
"Monokai": "#272822"
},
"tab-activeBorder": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#f8f8f8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeBorderTop": {
"Dark": "#0078d4",
"Light": "#005fb8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeForeground": {
"Dark": "#ffffff",
"Light": "#3b3b3b",
"Monokai": "#ffffff"
},
"tab-border": {
"Dark": "#2b2b2b",
"Light": "#e5e5e5",
"Monokai": "#1e1f1c"
}
}


Using aliasing across collections:


Colors collection:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e"
}


Tokens collection that references Colors variables:


{
"button": {
"Dark": "$black",
"Light": "$white",
"Monokai": "$grey"
}
}
plugins.tagline: Generate local Figma variables using JSON

plugins.name: Sequence frames
plugins.description:
Sequence frames

For mass creation of frames

  • You can enter values with any separators. Each pair of numbers will be considered as width and height, they will also be in the frame name.
  • Values can be copied from excel tables vertically or horizontally.
  • When entering values, it immediately shows how many frames will be created and with what sizes.
  • A value that has no pair (undefined) will not lead to the creation of a frame.


Для массового создания фреймов

  • Вписывать значения можно с любыми разделителями. Каждая пара чисел будет считаться шириной и высотой, они же будут в названии фрейма.
  • Значения можете смело копировать из таблиц excel хоть вертикально, хоть горизонтально.
  • При вписывании значений сразу показывает сколько фреймов будет создано и с какими размерами.
  • Значение, которому нет пары (undefined) не будет приводить к созданию фрейма.

plugins.name: Design Tokens (W3C) Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports Figma Variable collections into separate JSON files (with variables grouped by modes) in a .zip file for easy download. The files are formatted according to the Design Tokens spec defined by the Web 3 Working Group.


This standard can be consumed by tools such as Style Dictionary to parse your Figma Variables into variables that can be used in your code directly, across different stacks.


Documentation and usage details can be found in the GitHub repository.

accepted.name: Abel
accepted.description: I am a software developer with a passion for front-end magic and creating kick-ass user experiences

plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Variable collections in the Design Tokens spec into separate JSON files

plugins.name: Topo
plugins.description:
Review and report instances and components from Figma.


Topo is a Figma Plugin that will allow you report and comment on specific components and post it to any Slack channel or endpoint you want.


You can try Topo for free for up to 3 component reports. Once you buy a license you're entitled to a lifetime license key and updates, while supporting and contributing to build better features and more plugins and tools.


Get lifetime license


General usage:

  • Add Topo integration for Slack
  • With Topo opened, select an Instance or Component you want to review or report in your Figma file.
  • Hit 'Report'.
  • Check the Slack channel and keep track of what's being reported and resolved.


Crafted for design system and library management teams

Allow everyone to report component errors, bugs or issues in a single channel, integrated with the tools you use everyday. Keep track of what’s being resolved.


No need to stop designing

Stop jumping into calls and sending messages that get lost in the discussion. Report without leaving Figma.


Connect your own endpoint for integration with other tools

If you don’t want to use the default Slack app, you can send the reported data to any custom endpoint. Maybe your own API to create JIRA tickets?

accepted.name: Santiago Moreno
accepted.description: In love with Code, Motion and Typography. I really, really enjoy building stuff and prototyping 🇨🇴

plugins.name: SVG Auto Fix Path Directions (fill-rule)
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin to fix path directions, commonly named 'fill-rule' and 'winding order' in Figma.

You can use your existing export config, this plugin will export files to every format to a single ZIP file. It will also warn if files are duplicated because they have the same name.


This plugin is still in beta and is not tested for every usecase. If you have any bugs please get in touch :)


There isn't any customization yet. It uses the default SVGO fixes.




Source code is available at https://github.com/RemyyB/Figma-Plugin-FixPathDirections, feel free to update the plugin and tweak it, I do accept PR's. I am tweaking this plugin, it is still in beta, but don't expect a feature-rich plugin just yet.
plugins.tagline: A very simple plugin to fix path directions in Figma. Includes SVGO and exports into a ZIP file.

plugins.name: XTM Connect - Figma
plugins.description:
Figma and XTM Cloud – Picture Perfect

Figma’s design features bring ideas to life and make content sing.

XTM Cloud’s translation technology keeps the voices in tune for any audience.

With Figma and XTM Cloud, you can go where your imagination takes you.

  1. Synchronise between Figma and XTM Cloud and start translating design content from the moment of creation
  2. Give linguists visual context so they can tailor messages to multilingual audiences
  3. Make an image and a brand equally appealing and resonant in Berlin, Beijing and Buenos Aires


Intelligent Automation For Design Content

  1. Transfer of content from Figma to XTM Cloud is instantaneous
  2. XTM Cloud transcreation delivers creativity and a range of alternative translations to choose from
  3. Multilingual content is returned to Figma at the click of a button


You’re The Voice

  1. Project managers, linguists and designers all have valuable opinions to share
  2. XTM Connect - Figma unites each team members – and each voice – in pursuit of excellence
  3. No thread is lost, no question left unanswered 


Get It Fast And Get It Right

How it works:

  5. Run Jet Admin Export plugin
  6. Enter Import key from Jet Admin
  7. Click Export selected
  8. In Jet admin: reload Figma imports in Import from Figma popup and click import on the imported design

plugins.name: Hide Layer from Instances
plugins.description:
Iterations always demand new additions to components. All of us have encountered cases where we need to add something to a component but don’t want that to show up in all the hundreds and thousands of existing instances. We finally end up creating a new component so that the existing work is not affected. This plugin solves this issue with a single click.

Follow these steps to hide a particular layer from all component instances
• Select the layer/group/frame that you want to hide from one of the instances of a component
• Select Hide Layers from Instances -> Hide
• The selected layer/group/frame will be hidden from all instances in the current page

Use the Force Hide option if the layer that you want to hide is part of a component that is nested in multiple other components and you want to hide the layer in all of them at once.
Eg.: If you want to hide a layer in an icon component that is already used in various other components like different state and sizes of buttons, then Hide option will just hide the layer in the selected state or size of the button. Whereas Force Hide will hide the layer in all the instances of all the components that this icon is used.

This plugin works only on instances and not on components
CAUTION: When using the Force Hide option. ensure that the name of the layer you are hiding is unique. If not, multiple layers may get hidden.

Feels too small a feature for a plugin? There is also a Scripter File for this that you can use. https://www.figma.com/community/file/858014268242545394/Hide-Layers-from-Instances

Do let us know if you want any additional features. We'll try adding it. Cheers! :)

plugins.name: Figma Font Filter
plugins.description:
The Figma Font Filter plugin simplifies font selection and management in your Figma projects. Here's what it does:

  1. Find the most popular Google Fonts
  2. Filter by stroke, style (serif, sans-serif, etc.), or language, amongst other features
  3. Sort by popularity, what's trending, newest, or alphabetically
  4. Change the font size to preview how it looks
  5. Compare different fonts side-by-side
  6. Save your favourite fonts for easy access later, across projects
  7. Apply fonts to one or more Figma text layers with a single click


This plugin is useful for designers who want to speed up their font selection process. It helps you find, test, and use the right fonts for your designs without leaving Figma. Whether you're working on a new project or updating an existing one, the Figma Font Filter makes dealing with fonts easier and faster.


More about us? Visit cadre.pt.

plugins.name: Betafi: Import Notes and Embed Clips
plugins.description:
Bring user feedback to where product teams (Fig)jam

Import notes and clips from user feedback sessions into your FigJam board to easily review user requirements and usability feedback with your team and stakeholders.


How it works: Watch the demo

  1. Install the plugin and log in to your Betafi account (or sign up for Free).
  2. Select the project containing the notes/clips you want to bring over to FigJam.
  3. Click “Import All” or drag and drop selected notes/clips to FigJam.


Why Betafi?

  • Whether you use Betafi or Zoom (or Google Meet coming soon), you can use Betafi to capture the ‘aha moments’ and take notes within pre-created questions. Then import your notes to FigJam.
  • Post-call, dig out the ‘aha’ moments from your feedback calls using the recording synced with the transcript and your notes. And then import these important moments to FigJam.
  • You can also bring your Figma prototypes to Betafi, conduct moderated usability testing sessions, then clip videos of user struggles, and import the mini-clips to FigJam.


Your user insights should live on FigJam.

Try Betafi for FREE to avoid switching between multiple tools.

Learn More

plugins.name: CVA: Component Variants Automator
plugins.description:
It's time to save you some time!

Don't take "authority" too seriously, we are here to give you control!


With CVA you'll get to control how you want your components to vary without having to modify each variant by hand.


For now, if you create your component using the Cascading Components strategy you get to generate a Component Set with all possible variants. That's pretty useful to quickly check how your component will look and to document your design system.


You can also limit the number of generations by linking properties therefore avoiding generating a big button with a tiny text, for example.


🛝 Go to our playground to learn how to use CVA step by step!

🍿 Learn how to use CVA from our tutorial on Youtube.


We are in a lot of places, follow us on 🕵️

Instagram for tips 🧚

Twitter / X for updates 📣

Medium for some reading 📖

Youtube for tutorials 👩‍🏫

Discord for befriending us 🧞‍♂️

And please, ask for features and feedback on cva.canny.io 📮


But we are just starting and there's a lot more to come. We keep working to bring you more straightforward solutions for your designing needs, cause less clicks means more time for your creativity to flourish.


🕵️ PS: Our name is a reference to TVA, the Time Variance Authority. If you haven't watched the TV show Loki to get the reference, we highly recommend it!

Your time is sacred 🐊 
That is why CVA generates your component variants automatically for you!

With this plugin, you can create stunning color palettes using advanced machine learning algorithms based on any starting color. Additionally, you can generate unique, high-quality images using the Davinci AI model by simply providing a prompt. 


Moreover, if you have any design-related questions or prompts, this plugin can use OpenAI's text capabilities to provide you with accurate, insightful answers.


To get started, simply register with OpenAI to obtain your API token and start exploring the endless possibilities with this AI-powered Figma plugin AIquiry.

plugins.name: Token Studio Inspect
plugins.description:
Token Studio Inspect is a Figma plugin enabling users to generate tokens in the Inspect panel natively. It adds tokens to component descriptions, making it easy to inspect, select, and copy them. Tokens Studio Inspect detects token data from the Tokens Studio Figma Plugin. If no data is available, nothing is added to the component description.


Key features:

  • Generate tokens studio inspect. It will add token data to all components detected in files based on the tokens you apply in the component.
  • Delete tokens studio inspect. It will erase all token data from the component description of all components detected in the files.


Demo:

Watch the demo video here.


Limitation:

Tokens Studio can be applied to any layer in Figma. However, Tokens Studio Inspect are limited to components only, as Figma only allows descriptions within components.
plugins.tagline: Generate Tokens Studio inspect natively in Figma’s inspect panel

plugins.name: Figma User Generator
plugins.description:
Figma User Generator

Herramienta diseñada para generar perfiles de usuario con información pseudo realista y estructurada, lista para ser utilizada en tus diseños y prototipos en Figma.

Ya sea que estés trabajando en investigación de usuarios, creando mockups de producto o diseñando interfaces interactivas, este plugin te permite agregar perfiles con un solo clic, ahorrándote tiempo y facilitando tu flujo de trabajo. ✨


Características Principales

  1. Generación Automática de Perfiles: Obtén nombres, ubicaciones, emails, teléfonos y más, con datos basados en randomuser.me.
  2. Avatares Realistas: Cada perfil incluye una imagen de usuario en alta calidad.
  3. Tarjetas de Usuario en Figma: Inserta el perfil generado como una tarjeta con datos organizados y diseño optimizado.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Selecciona un género (masculino, femenino o aleatorio).
  2. Genera un perfil y visualiza su información en la tarjeta previa.
  3. Envía el perfil a Figma y se insertará automáticamente en tu archivo como una tarjeta estructurada.
plugins.tagline: Generar perfiles de usuario  pseudo realista  y estructurada, lista para ser utilizada.

plugins.name: Codia AI Office: Import Office File to Editable Figma
plugins.description:
Simplify Your Design Workflow with the Office to Editable Figma Plugin——The ideal solution for quickly converting your Office files into fully editable Figma layers. This tool enhances efficiency, precision, and security when transitioning from Office to Figma.


Key Features and Advantages


Fast Conversion

Instantly import your Office files into Figma with minimal loading times, speeding up your design process without sacrificing quality.


Fully Editable Layers

Every element from your Office file is converted into fully editable layers in Figma, ensuring you have complete control over adjustments and iterations.


High Compatibility & Perfect Conversion

Enjoy seamless compatibility between Office and Figma. The plugin ensures that all your design elements, including fonts, effects, and layer structures, are perfectly preserved during the transition.


Privacy Protection

Your files are handled securely throughout the import process, ensuring that your designs remain private and protected.


Supports Multiple Office Formats

Convert a wide range of Office file formats, including .doc / .docx / .docm / .dotx / .dot / .ppt / .pptx / .pptm / .pps / .ppsx / .pot / .potx / .odp / .pages / .key / .wps / .odt / .wpd / .abw / .xls / .xlsx / .xlsb / .xlsm / .xlt / .xltm / .xltx / .csv / .ods, ensuring flexibility across different document types.


Streamline Your Design Process

Using the Office to Editable Figma Plugin will revolutionize your workflow, saving you valuable time and effort. Instead of manually recreating designs in Figma or struggling with compatibility issues, this plugin automates the process, delivering pixel-perfect conversions with full layer editability.


Whether you’re part of a team collaborating on projects or working solo, the ability to instantly convert Office files ensures smoother design handoffs and iterations. With fast, accurate, and secure file conversions, you can focus more on creativity and collaboration, knowing your designs are perfectly preserved across platforms.


Call to Action☎️

For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI

plugins.tagline: Ideal solution for quickly converting your Office

plugins.name: 批量填充文本 Text Fill
plugins.description:
🤞在做表单设计的时候，大量文本修改非常繁琐，运用此插件可以一键替换所有文本

🎈使用说明

填充文本：选中要替换文案的文本，在输入框里面输入内容，一行对应一个，点击“填充文本”就可以了

选择文本：如果同时选中了很多类型的元素，选择文本可以只选中文本，取消选中其他类型的元素。如果选中一个画板，点击“选择文本”就可以快速选中画板中所有的文本

复制文本：把选中的文本复制到插件的输入框中

🍖附加功能

给文本添加前缀或后缀

给文本添加前编号或后编号，编号是输入起始值。比如输入1，就从1开始计数，输入10，就从10开始计数。也可以输入大小写字母，除了数字和字母，其他类型的字符将不生效。

倒序填充是输入框中的内容从尾到头填充
plugins.tagline: 批量修改文本，快速选择文本，复制文本内容

plugins.name: Markdown 文字转化
plugins.description:
该插件可以识别 Markdown 的标题（以 # 开头的行）和普通文本，按照预设的字体、字号、颜色等样式在 Figma 中创建相应的文本框。转化后的文本框会被自动组织成一个 Auto Layout，方便排版和布局。


如果 Markdown 文本中存在多个标题，插件会自动将标题和相应的文本组成一个小的 Auto Layout，多个小的 Auto Layout 又会组成一个大的 Auto Layout。此外，如果文本中存在多个段落，插件会自动将它们拆分为多个文本图层。


该插件现已支持主题：黑色文字和白色文字。你可以根据需要选择合适的主题，插件会根据选择的主题设置文本的样式。


该插件先已支持ChatGPT，你可以使用自己的api key 先润色文案，再转化样式


This plugin supports recognizing Markdown headings (lines starting with "#") and regular text, creating corresponding text boxes in Figma with preset font, font size, color, and other styles. The converted text boxes are automatically organized into an Auto Layout, facilitating layout and design.


If there are multiple headings in the Markdown text, the plugin automatically groups the headings and their respective text into a smaller Auto Layout, and multiple small Auto Layouts form a larger Auto Layout. Additionally, if there are multiple paragraphs in the text, the plugin automatically splits them into separate text layers.


The plugin also offers two themes: Dark Text and Light Text. You can choose the appropriate theme, and the plugin will set the text styles accordingly based on your selection.


This plugin already supports ChatGPT. You can use your own API key to refine the text and then convert the style.
plugins.tagline: 将Figma中的文本图层转化为特定的autolayout的文本样式

plugins.name: Design System Adoption
plugins.description:
The Design System Adoption plugin by David Vera gives you the ability to scan your Figma files for an in-depth analysis of the design system usage in your files.


Key features:

  1. Scan individual frame, pages or entire files to get detailed insights into how components from your design system are being used.
  2. Visualize your design system adoption data with a donut chart, offering a quick, easy-to-understand overview of how well your design system is adopted across your designs.
  3. Dive deeper into your analysis by zooming into specific elements within your Figma file directly from the plugin, making it easier to inspect and refine your designs.
  4. Streamline your scans by ignoring hidden layers, recognizing text styles and grouping detached components for a more focused analysis.
  5. Export the data – perfect for reports, presentations, and deep dives!


See why top design leads rely on this plugin for actionable insights into their design system adoption. This plugin gives you the full picture of your design system adoption in just a few clicks!


How to use:

Run the plugin on your component library.

Go to the Library tab and click Connect Library. It may take a little while to link your library.

Open any design file and run the plugin.

Select a frame and hit "Analyze frame". Optional: "Analyze page or file".


Why you need this plugin:

Whether you’re leading a team, managing a design system, or striving for consistency, this plugin is essential for tracking how well your design system is adopted across projects.


Get actionable insights, drive consistency, and improve the quality of your designs.


David Vera is a Design System Lead based in Toronto

If you have an idea, need help or just want to chat about Design Systems? Email me at designsystemplugin@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Track, analyze, and improve your design system adoption

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma — instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click “Select All” image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight — ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer — or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design’s mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

plugins.name: Get Some Ipsum
plugins.description:
Need some quick placeholder text for your designs? Get some ipsum! With a few clicks, you can generate the perfect amount of "lorem ipsum" copy to fit your selected text frames. Or if you prefer, specify a custom amount of text based on the number of words, characters, or paragraphs you need.


  • Sick of using the same paragraph of text over and over again? Generate completely unique copy blocks for multiple text frames at once.
  • Need headlines? Choose between title or sentence casing, and even decide whether or not to include periods.
  • Don't settle for awkward one-word sentences at the end of paragraphs. Custom logic evaluates the structure of all generated text to make sure it will look and feel just right.

plugins.name: JSONtoNodeGenerator
plugins.description:
Introducing JSON to Design Wizard, a powerful and intuitive Figma plugin that seamlessly converts your JSON data into stunning visual designs. This plugin aims to bridge the gap between data and design by providing an effortless way to transform raw JSON data into beautiful, customizable design elements within Figma.

Whether you're a designer working with data-driven content or a developer looking to visualize JSON data, JSON to Design Wizard is the perfect tool to enhance your workflow and boost your creativity.

Key Features:

Easy JSON Import: Import JSON data directly from a file or paste it into the built-in JSON editor.
Customizable Templates: Choose from a variety of pre-built design templates or create your own to match your project's unique style.
Dynamic Data Binding: Link JSON data to design elements, making it easy to update your designs when your data changes.
Auto-Layout & Responsive Design: Automatically arrange and resize design elements based on your JSON data, ensuring clean and responsive designs.
plugins.tagline: Plugin which provides JSON to Design conversion

plugins.name: Markdown to Figma Layers
plugins.description:
About

Converts Markdown into layers in Figma. Supports tables. Click "Show example" in plugin UI. If sample markdown is generated, yours should work, too.


What's supported

Tables, links, inline styles (only bold and strikethrough), up to 4 Headings, ordered and unordered lists.


What's ahead

Styles customization, checkboxes, maybe images from url, table heading styles could be fixed, support of row-based tables


How to support

Plugin is only published because I like likes. Give a like, share a comment if you're feeling generous, it will make my day 😌


FAQ


Part of my content is not generated. What happened?

It stops generating exactly where it faces markdown that is not handled. It can be a block of code, checkbox, heading level 5+ or something like that. Post a comment and I'll add support unless it's heading level 10 or nested table or something obscure like that.


Can I customize styles?

Not yet, styles are tailored for my project. If you need customization, pls, leave a comment so I'll know it's needed and will do my best to allocate time.
plugins.tagline: Convert Markdown into Figma layers. Tables supported

plugins.name: Icon Component Validator
plugins.description:
As recommended by Font Awesome, Figma’s Boolean Groups offer icon designers non-destructive and flexible editing capabilities, streamlining workflows and enabling efficient management of large icon systems.


By leveraging Boolean Groups, this plugin further enhances efficiency and consistency in your icon library by automating structural integrity checks and enabling color inheritance.


Key Features:

  1. Quick and smart validation
  2. Locate problematic component
  3. One-click fix
  4. Customizable


How to Use

  1. (Optional) Adjust settings to match your validation criteria
  2. Make a selection that contains components to check
  3. Click the "Validate Selection" button
  4. Review results and use "Locate" and "Fix" functions as needed


To try this plugin, you can duplicate the Charcoal Icons file, make any changes to the icons, and then run the plugin.

===


Font Awesome が推奨したように、Figmaのブーリアングループ（Boolean Groups）は、アイコンデザイナーに対して非破壊的かつ柔軟な編集機能を提供し、ワークフローを合理化し、大規模なアイコンシステムの効率的な管理を可能にします。


このプラグインは、ブーリアングループの活用によって、アイコンライブラリの効率性と一貫性をさらに向上させます。構造的な整合性の自動チェックや、色の継承を可能を担保します。


主な機能:

  1. 高速かつスマートなバリデーション
  2. 問題のあるコンポーネントの特定
  3. ワンクリック修正
  4. カスタマイズ可能

使用方法：

  1. （任意）バリデーション基準に合わせて設定を調整
  2. 検証したいコンポーネントか範囲を選択
  3. 「Validate Selection」（選択範囲を検証）ボタンをクリック
  4. 結果を確認し、必要に応じて「Locate」（特定）や「Fix」（修正）機能を使用


このプラグインを試すには、Charcoal Iconsを複製し、アイコンに変更を加えた後、プラグインを実行してください。
